greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of mobiles (circular rooted trees) with n nodes and k leaves.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
Index entries for sequences related to mobiles
formula: G.f. satisfies A(x, y)=xy+x*CIK(A(x, y))-x. Shifts up under CIK transform.
G.f. satisfies A(x, y) = x*(y - Sum_{i>0} phi(i)/i * log(1 - A(x^i, y^i))). - _Michael Somos_, Aug 24 2015
Sum_k T(n, k) = A032200(n). - _Michael Somos_, Aug 24 2015
mathematica: Do[A[x_, y_] = x (y - Sum[EulerPhi[i]/i Log[1 - A[x^i, y^i]], {i, 1, m}]) + O[x]^m + O[y]^m // Normal, {m}];
Join[{1}, Append[CoefficientList[#/y, y], 0]& /@ Rest @ CoefficientList[ A[x, y]/x, x]] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 02 2019 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = my(A = O(x)); if(k<1 || k>n, 0, for(j=1, n, A = x*y - x*sum(i=1, j, eulerphi(i)/i * log(1 - subst( subst( A + x * O(x^min(j, n\i)), x, x^i), y, y^i) ) )); polcoeff( polcoeff(A, n), k))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 24 2015 */
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, May 14 2000
